section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਿਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਦੁਇ ਕੰਨੀ ਮੁੰਦਾ ਪਰਮਿਤਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਖਿੰਥਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Let contemplation and intuitive meditation be your two ear-rings, and true wisdom your patched overcoat.

transliteration.text: surat simrit dui kannī mundā paramit bāhar khinthā .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਸੁੰਨ ਗੁਫਾ ਮਹਿ ਆਸਣੁ ਬੈਸਣੁ ਕਲਪ ਬਿਬਰਜਿਤ ਪੰਥਾ ॥੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the cave of silence, dwell in your Yogic posture; let the subjugation of desire be your spiritual path. ||1||

transliteration.text: sunn guphā mah āsan baisan kalap bibarajit panthā .1.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O my King, I am a Yogi, a hermit, a renunciate.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I do not die or suffer pain or separation. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਖੰਡ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੰਡ ਮਹਿ ਸਿੰਙੀ ਮੇਰਾ ਬਟੂਆ ਸਭੁ ਜਗੁ ਭਸਮਾਧਾਰੀ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The solar systems and galaxies are my horn; the whole world is the bag to carry my ashes.

transliteration.text: khand brahamand mah sinnī mērā batūā sabh jag bhasamādhārī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾਗੀ ਤ੍ਰਿਪਲੁ ਪਲਟੀਐ ਛੂਟੈ ਹੋਇ ਪਸਾਰੀ ॥੨॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Eliminating the three qualities and finding release from this world is my deep meditation. ||2||

transliteration.text: tārī lāgī tripal palatīai shūtai hōi pasārī .2.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਮਨੁ ਪਵਨੁ ਦੁਇ ਤੂੰਬਾ ਕਰੀ ਹੈ ਜੁਗ ਜੁਗ ਸਾਰਦ ਸਾਜੀ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My mind and breath are the two gourds of my fiddle, and the Lord of all the ages is its frame.

transliteration.text: man pavan dui tūnbā karī hai jug jug sārad sājī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਥਿਰੁ ਭਈ ਤੰਤੀ ਤੂਟਸਿ ਨਾਹੀ ਅਨਹਦ ਕਿੰਗੁਰੀ ਬਾਜੀ ॥੩॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The string has become steady, and it does not break; this guitar vibrates with the unstruck melody. ||3||

transliteration.text: thir bhaī tantī tūtas nāhī anahad kingurī bājī .3.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਸੁਨਿ ਮਨ ਮਗਨ ਭਏ ਹੈ ਪੂਰੇ ਮਾਇਆ ਡੋਲ ਨ ਲਾਗੀ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Hearing it, the mind is enraptured and becomes perfect; it does not waver, and it is not affected by Maya.

transliteration.text: sun man magan bhaē hai pūrē māiā dōl n lāgī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਤਾ ਕਉ ਪੁਨਰਪਿ ਜਨਮੁ ਨਹੀ ਖੇਲਿ ਗਇਓ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ॥੪॥੨॥੫੩॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, the bairaagee, the renunciate, who has played such a game, is not reincarnated again into the world of form and substance. ||4||2||53||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr tā kau punarap janam nahī khēl gaiō bairāgī .4.2.53.
